title: Energy & Forces Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of energy types and forces

questions.question: What type of energy does a moving bicycle have?
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy is the energy of motion. A moving bicycle has kinetic energy because it is in motion.

questions.question: Energy can be created and destroyed.
questions.explanation: According to the Law of Conservation of Energy, energy cannot be created or destroyedâ€”it can only change from one form to another.

questions.question: Which force pulls objects toward the Earth?
questions.explanation: Gravity is the force that pulls objects toward the center of the Earth, making things fall down.

questions.question: A ball sitting on top of a hill has _______ energy.
questions.explanation: Potential energy is stored energy based on position. The ball has potential energy because of its height on the hill.

questions.question: What happens when two north poles of magnets are brought close together?
questions.explanation: Like poles (north-north or south-south) repel or push away from each other. Opposite poles attract.

questions.question: Friction is a force that helps objects move faster.
questions.explanation: Friction opposes motion and slows objects down. It acts in the opposite direction of movement.

questions.question: When you turn on a flashlight, electrical energy changes into what type of energy?
questions.explanation: A flashlight transforms electrical energy from batteries into light energy (and some heat energy).

questions.question: Name one force and describe what it does.
questions.correctAnswer: Gravity pulls objects down, Friction slows things down, Magnetism attracts or repels magnets
questions.explanation: Accept any correct force with an accurate description: Gravity (pulls down), Friction (slows motion), Magnetism (attracts/repels), Applied force (pushes/pulls objects).
